{{Infobox legislature |background_color = #333366 |text_color = white |name = Wicklow County Council |native_name = Comhairle Contae Chill MhantÃ¡in |transcription_name = |legislature = |coa_pic = WicklowCrest.png|100px |coa_res = |house_type = County Council |body = |leader1_type = [[Cathaoirleach]] |leader1 = Derek Mitchell |party1 = [[Fine Gael]] |election1 = |members = 24 |political_groups1 = {{color box|{{Fine Gael/meta/color}}}} [[Fine Gael]] (9)

{{color box|{{Independent/meta/color}}}} [[Independent (politician)|Independents]] (3) |last_election1 = [[Irish local elections, 2009|5 June 2009]] |session_room = |session_res = |meeting_place = Ãras an Contae, [[Wicklow]] |website = {{URL|http://www.wicklow.ie/}} |footnotes = }} [[File:Wicklow in Ireland.svg|thumb|235px|The area governed by the council]] '''Wicklow County Council''' ({{lang-ga|Comhairle Contae Chill MhantÃ¡in}}) is the [[Local government in the Republic of Ireland|local authority]] which is responsible for [[County Wicklow]] in [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]]. The Council is responsible for [[House|Housing]] and Community, Roads and [[Transport]]ation, [[Urban planning]] and Development, Amenity and [[Culture]], and [[natural environment|Environment]]. The head of the council has the title of [[Cathaoirleach]] or "Chairperson". The [[county town|county seat]] is at Aras an Contae, [[Wicklow]]. The county council is governed by the [[Local Government Act 2001]]. The county is divided into five [[local electoral area]]s and has 24 councillors who are elected every five years by [[single transferable vote]]. The county administration is headed by a [[Council Manager (Ireland)|county manager]], currently Eddie Sheehy. ==Councillors== For the purpose of elections Wicklow is divided into five local electoral areas: [[Arklow]] (5), [[Baltinglass]] (3), [[Bray]] (7), [[Greystones]] (5), and [[Wicklow]] (5).{{cite web |url=http://electionsireland.org/results/local/council.cfm?election=2009L&area=276|work=ElectionsIreland.org|title=2009 local elections â Wicklow County Council|accessdate=18 November 2011}} ===2009 Seats summary=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" |- !colspan=2|Party !Seats |- ! Grainne McLoughlin was co-opted to fill Simon Harris's seat. â¡Nicky Kelly left the Labour Party in February 2011. ==See also== * [[Local Government (Ireland) Act 1898]] * [[Local government in the Republic of Ireland]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.wicklow.ie Wicklow County Council website] {{Local government in the Republic of Ireland}} {{Local administrative units of Ireland}} [[Category:Politics of County Wicklow]] [[Category:LAU-1 authorities in the Republic of Ireland]] {{Ireland-gov-stub}}
